intro: Ruagea yungasana, commonly known as the Yungasana ruagea, is a small evergreen tree native to the humid forests of northern Bolivia and southern Peru. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ruagea yungasana is adapted to the moist, shaded understory of its native habitat, where it plays a role in maintaining forest biodiversity.
